context: the patient healed status post rhinoplasty as a result but was left with a persistent saddle-nose dorsal defect.
procedure: revision rhinoplasty (cpt 30450). left conchal cartilage harvest (cpt 21235).
procedure: revision rhinoplasty (cpt 30450). left conchal cartilage harvest (cpt 21235).
this patient is an otherwise healthy male who had a previous nasal fracture.
during his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.
during his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.
during his healing, perioperatively he did sustain a hockey puck to the nose resulting in a saddle-nose deformity with septal hematoma.
the patient healed status post rhinoplasty as a result but was left with a persistent saddle-nose dorsal defect.
approximately 3 ml of 1% lidocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine was infiltrated into the subcutaneous tissues of the conchal bulb.
in addition to this, cocaine pledgets were placed to assist with hemostasis.
the patient did have very broad lower lateral cartilages leading to a bulbous tip.
the patient did have very broad lower lateral cartilages leading to a bulbous tip.

the lower lateral cartilages were trimmed in a symmetrical fashion leaving at least 8 mm of lower lateral cartilage bilaterally along the lateral aspect. having completed this, the patient had medial and lateral osteotomies performed with a 2-mm osteotome.

next, attention was turned to dorsal augmentation. a gore-tex small implant had been selected, previously incised. this was taken to the back table and carved under sterile conditions. the patient then had the implant placed into the super-tip area to assist with support of the nasal dorsum.

next, attention was turned to performing a columella strut. the cartilage from the concha was shaped into a strut and placed into a precision pocket between the medial footplate of the lower lateral cartilage.
there was no evidence of hematoma, and the patient had a series of brown steri-strips and aquaplast cast placed over the nasal dorsum.
he was charged to home on antibiotics to prevent infection both from the left ear conchal cartilage harvest and also the gore-tex implant area.
